avalancheActivity.comment: As a result of fresh fallen snow and strong-to-stormy SW winds, often trigger-sensitive snowdrift accumulations are being generated during the course of the day in ridgeline terrain, in gullies and bowls and in general above 1800m. These drifts can often be triggered by one sole skier. Releases tend to be small-sized. Apart from the risks of being buried in snow masses, the danger of taking a fall and being swept along also require consideration.

snowpackStructure.comment: Up to 20 cm of fresh snow is anticipated regionally, locally more. Accompanied by strong to storm-strength SW winds, fresh snowdrifts will accumulate. Shady slopes: the drifts will be deposited atop weak layers. The snowpack is expansively metamorphosed, and is highly diverse even over small areas. There is only little snow on the ground. Below 1600m there is often hardly any snow regionally.

weatherForecast.comment: On Sunday, gloomy/gray mountain weather with dense clouds, the summits often hidden in fog. Light snowfall (snowfall level at 1400m) in the morning in the Carnic Alps. A strong-to-stormy SW wind will be blowing with windspeeds reaching 40-70 km/hr. At 2000m: -1 degree. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.comment: As a result of fresh fallen snow and strong-to-stormy SW winds, often trigger-sensitive snowdrift accumulations are being generated during the course of the day in ridgeline terrain, in gullies and bowls and in general above 2400m. These drifts can often be triggered by one sole skier. Releases tend to be small-sized. Apart from the risks of being buried in snow masses, the danger of taking a fall and being swept along also require consideration.

snowpackStructure.comment: Up to 10 cm of fresh snow is anticipated regionally, locally more. Accompanied by strong to storm-strength SW winds, fresh snowdrifts will accumulate. Shady slopes: the drifts will be deposited atop weak layers. The snowpack is expansively metamorphosed, and is highly diverse even over small areas. There is only little snow on the ground. Below 1600m there is often hardly any snow regionally.

weatherForecast.comment: On Sunday, gloomy/gray mountain weather with dense clouds, the summits often hidden in fog. Light snowfall (snowfall level at 1400m) in the morning in the Carnic Alps. A strong-to-stormy SW wind will be blowing with windspeeds reaching 40-70 km/hr. At 2000m: -1 degree; at 3000m: -8 degrees. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.comment: Fresher snowdrift accumulations are generally small-sized, triggerable only in isolated cases, esp.on wind-protected shady slopes at high altitudes, esp. in transitions into gullies and bowls and at the foot of rocky cliffs and behind protruberances in the landscape. These danger zones occur seldom. Apart from the risks of being buried in snow masses, the danger of being swept along and forced to take a fall require consideration. On very steep sunny slopes, isolated small wet loose-snow avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Isolated danger zones in gullies and bowls

snowpackStructure.comment: Only minor fresh snow is anticipated. Accompanied by strong to storm-strength SW winds, small fresh snowdrifts will accumulate; the drifts will be deposited atop weak layers esp. on wind-protected slopes. The snowpack is expansively metamorphosed, and is highly diverse even over small areas. There is only little snow on the ground. Below 1600m there is often hardly any snow regionally.

weatherForecast.comment: On Sunday, gloomy/gray mountain weather with dense clouds, the summits often hidden in fog. Light snowfall (snowfall level at 1400m) in the morning in the Carnic Alps. A strong-to-stormy SW wind will be blowing with windspeeds reaching 40-70 km/hr. At 2000m: -1 degree. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches are hardly possible in gullies and bowls.

snowpackStructure.comment: The old snowpack is expansively metamorphosed, with a loosely-packed surface with surface hoar and faceted crystals. Very little snow on the ground. Hardly any snow on the ground below 1600m regionally.

tendency.highlights: No significant change expected in avalanche danger levels

weatherForecast.comment: On Sunday, gloomy/gray mountain weather with dense clouds, the summits often hidden in fog. Light snowfall (snowfall level at 1400m) in the morning in the Carnic Alps. A strong-to-stormy SW wind will be blowing with windspeeds reaching 40-70 km/hr. At 2000m: -1 degree. Source: GeoSphere Austria

customData.generalHeadline: Rising avalanche danger due to fresh snow, wind
